revised_title: A Historical Account of the Incombustible Linen Cloth and its Properties
tldr: The author investigates the historical accounts and properties of the incombustible linen cloth, also known as Amiantus or Asbestos, discussing its origins, manufacturing process, and various uses. The cloth is known for its fire-resistant properties, which have been documented by ancient authors such as Pliny and Caelius Rhodiginus.
